meanings.definition: A plant of the genus Salsola, especially Salsola kali, found in salty or alkaline soils.
meanings.sent1: The saltwort grew abundantly in the salty soil near the beach.
meanings.sent2: People enjoy using saltwort in their cooking to add a unique flavor.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous rabbit tried to hide behind the tall saltwort but failed miserably.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was like a patch of saltwort in the barren desert of cruelty.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant green color of the saltwort stood out against the pale sand.

meanings.definition: A plant of the genus Batis, found in coastal regions and salt marshes.
meanings.sent1: The saltwort by the shore provided a home for many small creatures.
meanings.sent2: Birdwatchers often spot unique species of birds near the saltwort in the marshes.
meanings.sent3: The salty breeze carried the scent of the saltwort all the way to the lighthouse.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter bubbled up like a spring next to the saltwort in the marsh.
meanings.sent5: The saltwort danced in the wind, a graceful performer in the coastal symphony.
